1.content:
“Hay Emma have you got those files I need?” I asked as I walked up to Emma, a fellow worker as she was at the photocopier. “Yeah, I already gave it to you remember?” answered Emma as she looked at me. “Really?” I said as I looked her strangely. “What is it? Don’t believe me?” said Emma as she gave me an odd look.

“Why don’t you check that folder of yours” said Emma as she looked at the folder that I was holding. I opened the folder and to my shock, it was there. “There you see” she said as she patted me on mine left shoulder as she left.
“What’s going on?” I asked as I noticed some sort of strangeness around me. “Joe! The boss wants to see you in her office” said Emma as she looked at me. I went off into the boss’s office and sat down on a chair.

“Joe…I’m sorry but I have to let you go” said Gina, the boss as she sat on her seat all high and mighty. “What did you say?” I said as I didn’t believe what I just heard. “Like I said I have to let you go due to downsizing” she answered. Just then, I felt the ground below me disappear.
“Right then, I believe its best that you should leave now” Gina said as she stood up and showed me out of the office. As I stood up and walked pass her, the two of us noticed that something was odd but shook it off. I went to my desk and began to pack my things. “Hay what happen…Joe?” asked Emma as she looked at me and saw that I was packing my things.

“I’ve been fired Emma…god! What else can go wrong?” I said as I picked up a box with my things inside. “Oh the company are gonna miss you” said Emma as she hugged me. “Thank you, well then, goodbye, hope to see you around sometime” I said as I walked out of the office.

I walked out to the car park and put my things in my car, got in and began to drive my way home. As I was driving, I felt like taking a detour home so I took the long way by along the seafront. As I was driving, I noticed that it was getting really dark as night was beginning to fall. I also noticed that there was hardly anyone else driving along the road; I looked out at the sea and began to see something strange.
Out in the far distance, something was shining throughout the darkness and it was growing bigger and bigger.

I stopped the car, got out and tried to get a better look the object that he could see. The shiny object was getting even bigger and was beginning to give off a colour which I could make it out as a dark green. I was beginning to panic as the green object slowly turned into what I could tell was lightning but it was coloured green. The lightning was heading towards me as I suddenly headed towards my car but before I could get in I was struck by the green lightning.

I couldn’t tell what happened next as I found it very hard to breathe then moments later everything went black.
I don’t know how long it’s been; it could have been hours or days but I heard something,

“Excuse me, sir?” said a female voice. I woke up with my eyes still closed. “Huh? Wha…where am I?” I asked as I opened my eyes and found myself back in my car at the seafront. “You’re at the seafront sir” said the woman again. I looked at the woman and noticed that she’s a policewoman. “Oh thanks for waking me…what time is it?” I asked as I looked up at her. The woman looks at her watch and answered, “Its just five minutes past seven” “Oh thanks officer, I will go then” I said as I started my car up and began to drive off.

“What the heck was that thing last night?” I thought as I was driving up to my drive through. I got out and entered my house. As I was wandering around the place, trying work out what I just been through, I noticed something strange about the house, it was like something was out of place. I went upstairs to take a shower and changed into a pair of clean clothes.

At that moment, I didn’t know that my life would turn upside down as the people I know and love will treat me differently. I first learnt this when I went to speak to Alexis, my girlfriend.

1122.content:
Looking around the room I found that everything seems more than a little off. The ceiling seemed just a bit higher, the couch a mite longer, and the chair I had been sitting in had its cushion up to the middle of my thigh instead of my knees as usual. As if that weren't enough to clue me in Alexis stood in front of me with a stern look on her face. I knew she was 5'8", she loved teasing me about it, but how could that explain me looking at her chin right now?

"Joe? Hello, Earth to Joe?" she called, and snapped her fingers sharply above my head. I dropped out of my daydreaming and looked her in the eyes, letting her know she had my full attention. "You know, maybe if you put half the effort into looking for a job as you did staring off into space you'd probably have another one by now."

"Come on babe, you know I'm trying my hardest," I explained, though ringing in my ears drowned out my own voice by the end. "My resume is tight and all my references are good, but these days people can look you up online so easily. I mean, you're six inches taller than me, and it can be rough for a 5'2" guy on the job market."

"Six inches? Five foot two? Have you been engaging in a bit of wishful thinking?" Alexis said while she suppressed a laugh. "Try eight inches, pipsqueak, you barely even break the five foot barrier." Again the ringing turned up, and Alexis said the same thing again with some slight differences. "Try ten inches, pipsqueak, you haven't quite broken the five foot barrier. Should we go get the measuring tape and find out if your dreams have come true though?"

I stood there, mouth agape, and looked up at Alexis as she shot higher in the sky. No, she wasn't growing, I thought, I must be getting smaller. But I remembered being taller just a few minutes ago, didn't I? After a moment's thought I reached a decision.

112211.content:
'4 feet...4...no...this isn't happening...' My mind scrambled, like static on a screen, before giving up entirely. Weightlessly, I fell forward, face first into Alexis's soft stomach. I held back tears and huffed loudly, trying to stop my body's visceral reaction to the absurdity surrounding me.

"C'mon honey, it's okay, I was just kidding." Alexis's arms immediately wrapped around my head, burying it into her navel. "I'm surprised you're taking it so hard, you're usually excited when I tease you."

She was right, I used to love her playful torts. I wanted so hard to tell her what was happening to me, but whatever it was seemed to be rewriting history. My entire paper trail, at that very moment, probably listed my height at 4 feet even, and if I started to flip out about it, I'd probably end up in an asylum. Until I could figure out a way to stop it, I'd have to keep it all a secret.

I reluctantly pulled my head away. "Oh, no, it's not you Alex, I guess I'm just shaken up over the whole job situation. Come on, let's go lay down cuddle a bit, it'll take my mind off of it."

Alexis smiled and ruffled my hair, "Whatever you say, Joey."

***

Nothing after that freak accident truly reassured me, but being cuddled up against Alexis came close. Her arms stretched around me and pulled me into her soft breasts. The rising and falling of her breath gently rocked my head, and for a moment I honestly felt like I could get some good rest, but the apprehension swirling in my mind refused to allow me to let go.

Alexis had already fallen asleep. I nestled closer to her warm body. Would she still find me attractive like this? She had given me a kiss before we had laid down. Was it as passionate as last night's? If nothing is changing about the world except my size, then her love for me should stay the same right? Then again, she had been treating me more diminutively since the storm...

'Jesus, Alexis, please don't abandon me...I need you...' I hadn't meant to say the words out loud, but they came out in a broken whisper regardless.

Alexis moaned in her sleep and tightened her grip around me. Hopefully I was just being silly...

***

The next morning...

112212.content:
"Joe. Honey. Pipsqueak," Alexis began, and the ringing returned at a low intensity. "I have a job now, which means I have to wake up early. You remember what that's like, don't you? Or has it been so long since you've worked that you've forgotten about things like being a responsible adult?" I cringed at her last sentence, though I could barely hear it over the ringing. This was probably going to cost me a bit.

I wrapped my arms around Alexis's legs and looked up at her pleadingly. "Come on, just one night? It won't be too bad, and I want to spend some time with you before you go off and become some big-shot."

Alexis smiled down at me and ruffled my hair. "Oh, all right," she said. "I guess if you're the size of a child you're going to act like one sometimes too. She walked over to the couch and laid down, then patted the cushion where she wanted me to sit. As soon as I did she wrapped her arms around me and pulled me close, making me feel small against her.

An idea popped into my head, as it was clear neither of us was really paying attention to what was on. "Alexis, do you remember how we first met?"

"Of course I do, it was so funny I don't think I'll ever forget. You were walking around looking lost, so I leaned down in front of you and asked you where your mom was. You said you didn't need her, but if I wanted to take you home I could. I'd never been asked out by a three foot tall mouse of a man before, so I went along with it." There was a slight buzzing, and she reiterated, "I'd never been asked out by someone three feet shorter than me, so I figured why not?" She kissed the top of my head and continued, "At first I just thought it'd be a funny story for my friends, but you've always been so sweet I can't say I have any regrets."

Great, so she had three feet on me now. At this rate I'd be a bug by the end of the week, and what then? Alexis always hated bugs.

The show ended and she pushed me off the couch, then stood up herself. "Come on, that's enough for me," she said. "You should come too, I don't remember where your step stool is for the bed." She walked toward the bedroom and I followed, looking up at her butt shaking back and forth as she walked. Once in the bedroom she picked me up and put me on the covers, then crawled under herself, wrapped her arms around me and fell asleep.

1122123.content:
The shrill alarm woke me from a dead sleep. I had slept for seven hours, but I still felt completely dead.

Next to me, Alexis's arms and legs stretched out to what, at my new size, seemed like a terrifying size. I had been with Alexis for a long time, but now the entire world felt foreign, like the expanding limbs under the blanket with me were from some sort of alien creature, much less my girlfriend.

Still, her familiar form popped out from under the blanket all the same, and she lazily padded her way over to the bathroom, mumbling her good mornings.

I listened her to wash her face and brush her teeth, wrapping the extra blankets around me tightly. Her footsteps filled my ears moments later.

"Aww, look at you, you're like a bite-sized burrito under there." Alexis cooed, which was followed by another ringing in my ears. The blankets felt just a touch heavier suddenly.

"I think I'm going to stay in bed for a bit longer, my head hurts a lot." I groaned, which wasn't entirely untrue.

"Well, if you think that's best, Joe. Just don't hurt yourself when you get out of bed." Alexis gave me a quick peck on the forehead and then continued her morning rituals. I dozed in and out of sleep, only awoken in full when her heels clicked loudly on her way out the door. "Feel better, champ. I'll see you tonight. And maybe return some of those emails, we could use the money." She said, before clicking and clacking down the stairs and out of the house.

Champ? Emails? What in the world was Alexis talking about?

I laid in bed for a brief while longer, before the buzzing questions in my head proved that sleep was no longer an option. To buffet my fall I threw the pillows onto the floor before hopping out of bed and wandering though my now enormous bedroom looking for my laptop. Finding it on the floor, next to Alexis's desk, I popped it open to check my emails, finding that the inbox was a great deal fuller than it used to be. The first message caught my eye.

"Subject: Mr. Enron, please consider appearing on our local show." It was from a local television studio which filmed a popular morning show. Why the hell would they want me on?

"Dear Mr. Enron," The email read, "Given your status as the shortest American, we would love to interview you on AMD Morning Hot Shots. Please contact us at..."

Shortest...American? No. Fucking. Way.

My tiny fingers, spread out like a child's at a grand piano, flew over the keyboard, searching for confirmation. Wikipedia's article on shortest people held true to the email. There I was, listed at the bottom, far from the shortest person in the world, but short enough to be mentioned: 'Joe Enron, Shortest American, 29 inches. No interviews ever given.'

If this kept up, I would eventually become the shortest man on Earth, and then keep smashing through barriers. Would history keep rewriting itself like this? How would the world rationalize if I was ant sized? Would I be a medical marvel? Would I be Alexis's little bug boyfriend? Or would history and memory rewrite themselves so that I was never known, just a pest living in Alexis's house? If it could make her remember a past that never occurred, could it make her remember a past without me at all?

More importantly, would my actions bow affect the way this weird reaction worked later? If I went on that talk-show and gained some modicum of fame, would it be harder to be rewritten as never existing?

"Do you mind if I join you on this small walk, shorty? I promise I'll walk slow so you can catch up." Her barrage of friendly insults kept growing her. Easily becoming 5'9", this was going to be a long day. We continued to walk, with her making fun of my height every ow and then, only adding to her own. But the time we were done walking, she was at a towering 7'4" putting me eye level with her hips.

She needed to go, she bent down to give me a massive hug, picking me up even! As she put me down, she called me shorty again, making her 7'7". She then left, leaving me alone again.

info.brief_description: Sticks and bones may break my bones, but words can always shrink me
info.description:
I've been fired from my job and as I took a detour home I got caught up in a storm which blocked my way home. After that I was struck by lightning and survived. As that didn't make things worse, I tend to notice the way people act around me, my family ignore me, my friends humiliate me and my girlfriend, well, she belittle me. Well lets just say its now beginning to manifest within me.

Joe Enron
Main character
Hard worker but was shocked to learn that he was fired. Taking a detour home, he got himself caught up by a storm and after that he found himself being ignored, humiliated and belittled by the people he care about. He found himself shrinking.

Alexis Jones
Girlfriend
Joe's girlfriend that lives with Joe. She loves Joe deeply but after the storm, Alexis tends to belittle Joe about being unable to get a job.

Diana Enron
Big sister
Diana looks out and care for Joe but after the storm, Diana tends to ignore Joe pretty much about everything.

Cali Enron
Little sister
Always look up to Joe and tend to order him about, after the storm, Cali tends to ignore Joe when ever he doesn't do what she asks.

Nicole Belton
Joe's best friend
Joe's childhood friend, she looks out for him and she secretly loves Joe. Nicole is the only person that doesn't treat Joe differently after the storm.
